title: Aldermore takes on the challenge with doubled profits
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Aldermore takes on the challenge with doubled profits Aldermore has been upset by George Osborne’s 8 per cent corporation tax surcharge on lenders making profits of more than £25m Oli Scarff/Getty Images Google+ 1 of 1 Aldermore has been upset by George Osborne’s 8 per cent corporation tax surcharge on lenders making profits of more than £25m Oli Scarff/Getty Images Harry Wilson City Editor Published 1 minute ago 
One of Britain’s growing band of so-called challenger lenders has more than doubled profits less than six months after making its London stock market debut. 
Aldermore yesterday reported pre-tax profits for the first six months of the year up 112 per cent to £40 million as it recorded double-digit growth in loans to smaller businesses and residential mortgages. Excluding the £4.1 million cost of its March IPO, which raised £75 million, Aldermore said that its first-half profits would have been £44 million compared with £20.8 million for the period a year earlier.
